reviews.review_msg: She is only makes you right one essay but the topics are dumb for a intro class. Not really a fair marker its her way or the highway. But pretty interesting and she is a good prof and her exams are pretty chill

Very fair prof, not good or bad. She posts her notes online and has super easy exams (as long as you study and understand the terms, you pass the class for sure). The hardest part of the course is participation in tutorials and units readings etc. but very fair and interesting class.

Easy enough class. Posts slides online. Didn't read the textbook and still did well on the midterm and final. Midterm: 10 MC and essay, final: 12 MC, 1 SA, 1 essay. Both were short and very fair. Paper was marked quite hard but i had a terrible TA so that may vary depending on the TA. Tutorial participation is 15%, so go to tutorial and speak up!

She is a good prof. Grading in the essay section of the exam is a bit iffy. Even if you make valid arguments, if they are not part of the list of arguments she gave the TAs you won't get the mark. Her textbook is also full of typos which is extremely frustrating to read. With that said, she is still better than most other profs out there.

I took POL 101W as a last minute elective and I honestly didn't think I would like it... but it was great!!! I learned a lot from Eline, and she had really informative, and high-energy lectures! The course is pretty easy, especially the midterm, and the TA's were very helpful with the final paper. I really recommend this class!
Great professor who really tries to lay down the foundations for a political science education. The course material can be dry at times but that's just because it is an introductory class.

great prof! easiest course i've ever taken. midterm and final were piece of cake. essay required some effort (obviously). lectures are interesting and she tries to maintain attention with several discussions on various topics. tutorial participation is key. lecture attendance will suffice for exam, textbook content is all covered in lecture.

She might come across as a bit strict but as long as you're not a terrible student you won't have problems. Her lectures were clear and easy to follow, and she'd often make them a bit more interesting by provoking some discussion. The slides were always posted online, and the workload/readings were fair. Good prof all around.

Extremely organized and prepared professor but she is a hard marker! You need to attend all of the lectures and anything she says is fair game for an exam. That being said, she was extremely straight forward with what she was expecting.
Her lectures are boring and dry. Midterms and exams are based on memorizing the texbook and leave no room for your own interpretation of course concepts.  However, she is very organized and clear.

Shes a nice teacher, however her expectations for a first year class are a little excessive. Final is cumulative and there is an abundant of information and terms to learn, for only 10 multiple choice questions and an essay. Participation in tutorials are key.

A very wonderful lecturer. Clear, concise, and to the point. Her assignments are fair as are the exams. She always seems on top of her lecture and never lost or confused. Very helpful afterwards if you need it. Overall not difficult as long as you put in the work.
Comments are blunt but VERY constructive. Encouraging and very knowledgable. Approachable and friendly. Definitely recommend!

Josh is definitely a great teacher. He is a very engaging TA and emits that appeal of a teacher, something that we all wish all teachers had. He is not perfect but neither are we. If you do poorly because of his marking - it is justified. He truly cares about his students and does not grade unfairly, and it really comes down effort :)
"I don't know how that answer that, but that would make an excellent masters thesis."
Talks about apartheid more than probably necessary, but a cool guy.

He was very clear about what he wanted for his papers and the exams. His classes were always fun to participate in, He articulated the material very clearly and I never lost focus. Our tutorial debates were very enjoyable and he is encouraging and provides a comfortable space for participation.

Horrible professor. Unpunctual, disorganized and distracted during lectures. Get ready for him to discuss trump and mention a sentence about stuff you need to learn. Boring lectures, mostly mumbles, very difficult to make organized notes in his class. Doesnt use canvas, so all PowerPoints are put 2 days before exams.

Brian is a nice guy, but when when it comes to teaching- he is not the best. Yes, he knows the material, but he cannot communicate it effectively at all. Like others have mentioned, he is very unclear, unpunctual, and disorganized-our due dates were changed so many times I lost track. On top of that, he hardly replies to any emails.

Sometimes late to class, often went over time, midterm was straightforward but didn't tell us why we got things wrong, lots of reading that he doesn't remind you about (check syllabus at least once a week), changed the term paper due date twice but his feedback on our first copies was pretty good. Get ready to debate in tutorials!

Brian is a very fun and humble prof. With the midterm, it was a bit hard for me since he didn't specify why some answers weren't right and he'd just cross over them. But for the paper he gives a lot of time and multiple chances to improve your grade. He's very accessible through phone outside of the class. Tutorial attendance isn't mandatory.
really confusing, made a lot of jokes, not a good class

Didn't purchase the textbooks and still ended up with an easy A. The midterm and final are the exact same questions as the reviews he posted on canvas. He is a sloppy writer though and his notes aren't very linear.

His teaching style consisted of him scribbling across the board and talking in no way any students could understand. Did not explain concepts well at all. Textbook heavy; tests directly on the texts even though he does not mention it. Both midterm and final had things we had not learned that semester. Always late; forgot students' papers often.

midterm and final had a lot of stuff we never learned. Assigned readings every week, never mentioned them in class but they are testable. Takes time marking papers and if you're one of the few that doesn't get theirs marked on time he tells you to come to his office hours to pick it up but doesn't show up himself so you waste a trip to campus

1)Friendly and helpful 2)Writes all notes VERY DISORGANIZED way ON THE WHITE BOARD ALL THE TIME 3)No use of Canvas, contacts you way too late about essay/exam 4)Too much of exam is based on readings which you have to trek to the library to get or find, btw he is very vague on how to get them. 5)Late ALL the time tip: research on ur own for exam!!

By far one of the worst profs I've ever had. Completely disorganized, always shows up to class at least 10 minutes late. His notes follow no sort of order or flow and most of the time are not related to the textbook at all. Gives absolutely no feedback on exams and his marking is unjustified. It is clear he does not care at all for his students.

Brian is funny and is extremely talkative but the material he covers in class barely resembles the reading material and the material he does test you on are only based on the textbook. His lectures are long, boring, unorganized, and confusing.
Super nice, friendly guy. I went into political science expecting to fail, and was pleasantly surprised with my final grade! There is a lot of difficult content, though.

Nice guy, grades as if your PHD program. weekly posts need to be replied to every single students posts and then some in order to get full participation marks. Long time in getting marks back, writing requirements are excessive and you have no idea of where your sitting with marks going into final. Avoid this class take POL100 for easier grade

I didn't like this course at all. I think I had a bad TA so that did't help whatsoever. Andrew Heard is using the same outdated textbook - references 2010 Olympics, 9/11 terrorism, and the Harper government. Some of the online modules Heard writes are worded weird and hard to follow. SO MUCH READING for being tested on such specific things. DO NOT.

Being a 4th year student, I did not expect this class to be as difficult as Dr. Heard made it out to be. He is a very strict marker for a first-year introductory course. Had I known this, I would have not taken the class with him and waited another semester with a different professor.

Took POL 101W online w Heard. Good guy, gives helpful feedback, & course is pretty clear overall. Although as others have pointed out, marking on essays is tough for a 100 level class so it's not an easy A. For tests, he won't tell you exactly what to study but they midterm & final are pretty straightforward. You'll likely need the textbook.

Unlike others, I thought Heard was a pretty decent prof. His lectures are clearly delivered, with many examples to follow concepts. The exams were fair. My only complaint is the 10 page paper we had to write - for a 100 level course, it was too much.
Was my first pol class and absolutely my last class with him. Wish I didn't take his class or at least take it with another prof
I can't understand why he has such high rating ?! yes he is a good person but at the end of the semester you want to get a good grade. right? then just forget about pol101

Very disappointed in this teacher.  His feedback on assignments was unclear as were his assignment guidelines.  If you want good grades, stear clear of this prof.  I think his marking is unreasonably harsh for an intro course.

Dr. Heard was one of the best profs I've had at SFU. I didn't do as well as I wished I did in the class but he made boring material, not so boring. I would recommend! But don't expect an easy mark. There is only 4 marks throughout the semester, so keep on top of it!

he is nice as person but he isn't nice when it come to grade. TAs marking very hard, if you go to him and ask him to re-mark your exam or paper, he won't... as other said, don't take it if you want a good grade
trouble trouble trouble, I was soooo interested in pol but I hated this class due to the TA and Andrew won't do anything to the TA's mark. I won't take any other pol. avoid it, if you don't need it

ok as the other said he is very nice guy, the subject is easy overall. my main issue was the TA, I don't know who he chose his TAs, almost everyone dislike his TAs. Good class but not an easy A or B+. If you are not interesting in pol $ want goodgrade don't take it

Pretty much don't even need to go to lectures since he posts the PP slides and audio recordings on canvas. Textbook is barely needed since tests are almost 100% based off the PP slides. Had a 15% participation mark in tutorial. But they're so boring. And my TA is whack at marking papers. I'm certain if I had another one I'd get a better mark on it.

Gives in depth notes, and puts them online. Also posts an audio of the lecture online, so there is really no point of going to lecture except for the fact that he unnecessarily expands on the points on his power point and goes on and on for about half an hour per slide. He is approachable and pretty funny. I do recommend this class.

Poli sci 100 and 101w uses (word for word) the exact same powerpoint slides and the exact same workload. So take 101w for the w credit and take it with Andy because he's awesome. You can tell he genuinely enjoys the subject, he's hilarious, and his charisma is infectious. I plan on taking my next poli sci class with him!
Took this DE and it was a terrible course, terrible TA, unreasonably marked for a intro 100-level course. Do not recommend this torture on anyone
Took this distance education and it was a HORRIBLE course. Allen the TA was not helpful and marked unreasonable for a first year course. Overall, do not recommend this course whatsoever.

Don't take this course dist ed if you want a good grade. The class is not curved and the highest grades given out were: 80% for the final, 79% for the term paper and 79% for the shorter essay. I worked my ass off and only managed a C+ because of how hard and unreasonably everything was marked

This is my first semester at SFU, I wanted to major in poli sci but after this course I decided to major in crim instead. The TA (Allen) marked unreasonably hard and provided no real feedback on essay drafts or after giving out test marks/ essay marks as to what was wrong/needed improving. Overall I wouldn't recommend this course
Need to attend classes or listen to lecture recordings to do well. I had no interest in this topic whatsoever, but at least his teaching style was good and at times he is quite entertaining.

I took this in distance education so I never actually sat through his lectures but his study guide was well written, clear and interesting for the most part. The TA (Allen) was a complete doorknob though. He is unclear, doesn't answer your questions and is a unreasonably hard marking. Heard seems genuinely nice though and seems to love his job

Dr. Heard is a delight! His lectures are very enthusiastic and helpful, and he gives very good examples which make the material easy to understand. He also answers any questions you ask during class. He wrote one of the chapters in the textbook for the class, so he knows the material very well.

Had Prof Heard for half the semester. Very fun guy! Makes a totally dull subject bearable. He outright gives hints during lecture of exam material to help out. Tutorials were very helpful & TA's were great. I'm not a polisci student and this course has convinced me to never be one, but if I had to take another polisci course, it'd be with Andy.

Amazing prof! Very clear and passionate about his work. His exams were very on-par with his lectures and he gave very helpful hints as well. Overal, I highly recommend him. His TA Melissa D. was just as amazing and helpful as he was!
Just finished my final, AWESOME professor. Tests are fair, interesting professor, little assignment, gives all the hint u need to know for final and midterms. His TA Ann is awesome!

extremely fair proffesor final exam is no suprises if he talked about or emphesis on it or even told you its gonna be on exam great prof really helpful have recording for lecture and posted notes and ALSO internet quizzes for review for each chapter take him gpa booster

Read the chapter content beforehand. If you have little knowledge of what you are going to learn, you are probably not going to understand quite a few things easily. Read the textbook and if possible, read materials relating to the topics. This will help. He's a pretty nice professor. But don't ever consider cheating on the writing assignment.

AWESOME class and amazing prof!  He was very funny.  So animated and passionate about politics.  I love politics too, but I can see how even the most typically apathetic Canadian youth would find Andrew interesting.  I hope I have him again in my future courses.

The best first year prof I had. Knew what he was talking about. The TA's were also helpful. The midterm was a bit hard with attention to detail. He knew what he was talking about and the TAs did an amazing job of taking it to another level. Great first year class.
Very interesting professor, very helpful and quite funny. I liked this class a lot, and look forward to taking another one with him soon. "You're all sheep!"

I found that attendance was not mandatory but he gives engaging lectures and elaborates well on his lecture slides. Fair marker over all and straightforward. I appreciate his humourous remarks in class. We also had a take home final as he had to take a trip overseas. Would definitely take another course with him.

Logan is very passionate about his area of studies and makes lectures interesting. The class was a writing heavy class which required a draft and final essay. The lecture is based of the slides which are sent to you. The essay is the hardest part of the class.

Material wasn't too interesting but that's not his fault. Only gave an 8-10 page paper which is nothing considering its a writing course. Final was a take home non-formal essay & we got 3 days to do it which alleviated stress but he might not do this every time. Pointless tutorials but he was easy. Would recommend just make sure you pay attention!

Logan is a very clear, straight-forward prof. He explains well and often is interesting to listen to. Marks fairly and really helps prepare you for exams. Only possible downside would be heavy lecture slides, but they are made available to you prior to the lecture.
Not too helpful and respectful to students, ppt lectures made attendance not mandatory, long and boring essay to those who are not really into pol-sci. Don't re commend to others.

He's passionate about the subject and his lectures are very interesting. The paper is long, but you get good feedback from it. His exams are reasonable, but they require that you study the textbook in detail. I would definitely take his class again!

I took this course as an elective. My TA was also my prof. I got an A on my term paper (it was easy).  Not a hard course, the content was similar to Social Studies in high school, but it took me a long time to go over the slides and the textbook. The lecture was not that boring. I recommend this course if you're interested in politics.

Straightfowardclear lectures and grading scheme and he's a nice guy.  Keeps lectures pretty funny. Easy enough if you study the lecture notesread the textbook. Feels like a high school socials course tbh. Have to write a 10 page paper if you take the W version (instead of POL 100).  Overall GPA booster

Such a great professor and his classes are super interesting but sometimes would get boring because he doesn't show any media or video clips to break up the lecture. Midterm and final are pretty easy. I would recommended anybody who has an interest in politics to take him. Favourite professor so far. Very kind and passionate about the subject.

Nice guy, should not be a TA. Participation is a huge part of your mark in the class, yet he doesn't allow for much chances to talk. He spends 85% of the time talking, and when he does allow student to talk he will cut them off if not interested in what they have to say. He talks about issues not related to the readings and doesn't clarify anything
Liked him; went to him with an issue for my paper and he was super-helpful and not a hard marker.

Took over for Heard halfway through the term. He wasn't able to hold the class' attention (his accent + his long examples) but his lectures were funny and informative. I think he probably would be better at a less general, higher level course though.
Sanjay is a great lecturer, he's young and knows how to connect with the class. The course material was super great. I decided to take another course with him because it was so good. He is a 10/10
Amazing prof! Taking POL 200 with him now because I enjoyed his teaching style, his tests were super easy, and papers were super straight forward! Loves to help out students and overall a great prof!
